Exit poll predicts huge win for pirate candidate

By James Bithell

An exit poll released by YUSU forecasts a huge majority victory for pirate candidate Tom Scott in the race for the YUSU President.

Election candidates face one-day campaign ban after breaching regulations

By James Bithell

Three contenders in the YUSU elections have been banned from campaigning on campus following a breach of election regulations.

Takeaway company banned from delivering to campus

By James Bithell

Efes, the local fast food outlet situated on Heslington Road, has been banned from making deliveries on campus by YUSU and University Security.

Former student escapes jail sentence in fraud trial

By James Bithell

Former York student Elnar Askerov and his accomplice have been sentenced to a suspended jail term and ordered to undertake 300 hours of community service each after attempting to defraud the University.

By James Bithell

Presidential frontrunners Payne and Kunwar forced to defend their election promises as pirate candidate Scott confirms that he wants the job.

By James Bithell

By James Bithell

By James Bithell

Grace Fletcher-Hackwood claims she was driven out because she was a "personal hate figure" for the campus right.

By James Bithell

Heidi Blake speaks to Grace Fletcher-Hackwood on the eve of her departure from the University of York.

Wave of thefts on campus leads to arrests in Langwith college

By James Bithell

Two men have been arrested on campus following a series of thefts of laptops and other high value items from student accommodation blocks.

York student admits running essay business

By James Bithell

A second-year English student has admitted writing essays for students at other universities. He claims to have never written essays for a fellow York student.

RAG suffers as Raid profits split with YUSU

By James Bithell

Despite a record-breaking RAG Parade collection total of PS3,500, RAG Week 2008 looks set to fall short of last year's total.

York students join Scientology protest

By James Bithell

University of York students joined an international protest against the Church of Scientology last weekend.

NUS gives universities 'invoice' for PS24m originally budgeted for financial support

By James Bithell

The National Union of Students (NUS) has launched a campaign demanding that UK universities hand over PS24m "owed" to students in financial support.

Mature students President resigns following angry row with Canning

The President of the Mature Students Association (MSA) has resigned his post following major personal differences with YUSU President Anne-Marie Canning.

Police question York 'bomber'

By James Bithell

Police have continued to question a 43 year old man gunned down in the city centre after claiming to have explosives.

YUSU moves to purchase Langwith's bar for union

The University has decided to increase its total bursary budget by 9% in order to accommodate government changes in bursary brackets.

Accomodation policy criticised

The University has been criticised following a legal dispute where a landlord unsuccessfully tried to sue her tenants for withholding a proportion of their monthly rent.

All proposed motions pass at UGM

The YUSU Union General Meeting, held on January 31, drew a record numbers of votes and, in an unprecedented result, all the proposed motions were passed.

National ID card may be required for student loan

The National Union of Students (NUS) has spoken out against new government proposals to force students into holding an identity card in order to apply for a student loan.

York student play selected for NSDF

A University of York student play has been accepted to the prestigious National Student Drama Festival (NSDF) it was announced last week.

Film campaign for Derwent kitchens

Derwent Chair Oliver Lester has begun a film campaign to protest against the kitchen facilities in the Derwent extension blocks.

YUSU to buy two new golden ducks

YUSU wish to purchase two new ducks to replace the famous 'Trevor' duck that died over the summer.

JCR chairs protest state of facilities

JCRC chairs have sent a letter to the University expressing concern at the lack of adequate facilities.

Hackwood decides against appeal

Former YUSU Academic and Welfare Officer Grace Fletcher Hackwood has announced she will not appeal after being forced to resign following a vote of no-confidence.

Womens' committee to be opened to men

By James Bithell

Male students at York can now officially attend the YUSU Women's Committee after the motion to allow free access to all students passed today.

Hackwood ousted by eight votes

By James Bithell

Grace Fletcher-Hackwood will be forced to resign immediately after losing a vote of no-confidence by 8 votes.
